nodes.name: Planet Start
nodes.description: You come across a grey planet. It looks familiar, though you swore you've never come across this sector of space before.

choices.name: Ignore the planet.
choices.delay_message: Whatever, there's a lot of planets in space. Must be a hunch!

nodes.name: Scanning from Orbit
nodes.description:
You initiate a long range scan from orbit:
This planet has a smoggy cover that blocks any good look at the surface, yet it has a mostly survivable atmosphere.
This planet has zero life signs.

nodes.name: Orbital Descent
nodes.description:
As you descend into orbit, you see a flying object headed straight for you!
A garbled voice begins to call out to your drone, but there's no time to decipher it!

choices.name: Attempt Evasive Maneuvers!
choices.delay_message: You attempt to dodge the UFO...

choices.name: Do NOTHING. Jesus take the wheel!

nodes.name: UFO Evasion!
nodes.description: Were you good enough at flying to avoid the UFO?

choices.name: No, Back to flight school with you!

nodes.name: Tractor Beam
nodes.description:
Before you have time to think, your drone is captured by a Tractor beam! Now you've gone and done it.

You should have some time before you are pulled in.

choices.name: Look at the surface of the planet
Let the beam pull you in and dock you

nodes.name: Deciphering Transmission
nodes.description:
You review the incoming transmissions your drone has gotten. These aren't in need of deciphering, just un-garbling it from the bad connection...

"You are in Space British Air Space! Identify yourself, Tally ho!"
What the fuck?

choices.name: Good thing I didn't blast them, then.

nodes.name: Landed, Kinda
nodes.description:
You have been locked to the surface the beam. Robots are all around you, pointing at your drone with all sorts of old age weapons.

One of them angrily shouts at you, "By God, Queen and Country, we've got you now!"

choices.name: Go out with a bang. Initiate self destruct!
Surrender to the funny looking robot brits...

nodes.name: British Courtroom Start
nodes.description:
Wow, that took forever. A one eye judge robot smacks their gavel, and points their hammer at you.
"I will now read out the crimes you are accused of!"
Is that how the judicial process works? You dunno.
"ONE ACCOUNT OF PLANETARY TRESSPASS!"
This blows.

nodes.name: British Courtroom, Continued...
nodes.description: This big idiot they call a judge just keeps piling on crimes. With each one, some robot you'd like to drone-punch gasps in the back.

choices.name: "AND WE HAVE PROOF YOU KNEW IT WAS JUST AN AIRLINER!"
"THE TRANSMISSIONS WERE NOT LEGIBLE AND UNTRANSLATED. WE CANNOT PROVE MALICE!"
I think it's done listing crimes, thank god. Time to argue my case.

nodes.name: Looking at the Surface
nodes.description:
The surface of this world looks exactly like a grey version of Earth! It seems to be an exact replica of some kind.

You see creatures moving around on the streets

nodes.name: Robo Brits!
nodes.description: Wow, they're robotic humanoids that look and act exactly like the British! You see some robots laughing and chatting at a pub, and a Bobby walking down the street looking for crooks. Who created this earth replica? You only know Earth from the books, but you should be where London is!

choices.name: Nice! Well, back to getting pulled in by a Tractor beam...

nodes.name: Verdict
nodes.description:
Before even getting to defend your case, the judge says "I've heard ENOUGH! It's time for a verdict!"
Dang! You're definitely in kangaroo court!
"GUILTY! AND YOUR SENTENCE IS:"

choices.name: "SPACE JAIL!"
choices.exit_node: Not Actually Space Jail, Just Normal Jail

choices.name: "FORGIVENESS! Just trespass? That's not that bad!"

nodes.name: Not Actually Space Jail, Just Normal Jail
nodes.description: You'll have to wait out your crimes against the robo brits.

nodes.name: Sweet Sweet Freedom!
nodes.description: You're free! You spend a good while travelling around England (or at least the replica) and enjoying the cuisine, people and culture! Good society research is gained from this or something, but really you're just enjoying the sights and sounds.
